column4: I'd like to install gnome (and X and all that comes with it), but I don't want to run the whole X login frontend.  I just need gnome for some vnc stuff that will be running off this box.  Is it possible to either avoid installing the login stuff (if so, what's it called?), and if not, can it be disabled?
I bet a billion things are dependent on it, eh?
is the X-login stuff a different init level?
um..its the same as when you do startx, except gdm manages how many gnome sessions are running and lets you login graphically
